original_title: Good rice harvest doubtful with prolonged dry spell: Amaraweera
original_body_lines: An adequate rice harvest is doubtful as the country has been hit by a prolonged drought at a time when the growing paddy pods have begun to appear in rice fields, Minister of Agriculture  Mahinda Amaraweera told Parliament.

“Paddy is not the only crop that has been affected by the dry spell but others including banana and vegetables as well. We have discussed these matters in the Cabinet and the responsibilities will be fulfilled,” the Minister added.

“We are happy with the Cabinet decision to release water from the Samanalawewa. We are also glad that it has been possible to release water to some extent. It is essential that Parliament comes up with a policy on irrigation and power generation as well,” Minister Amaraweera said.

Also the Minister proposed the appointment of a policy-making body comprising representatives from the Agriculture Ministry, Ministry of Power and Energy and the Department of Meteorology.(Yohan Perera and Ajith Siriwardana)
